holistic_ikigai_analysis.methodology: 3-phase comprehensive analysis using full context windows
holistic_ikigai_analysis.primary_ikigai: Protecting and controlling personal digital identity (account security & privacy)
secondary_areas: Technology & productivity tooling (email and Microsoft ecosystem)
Automation and organization of digital life

supporting_evidence.pattern: Prioritizes account security and privacy as a daily concern
examples: Notification: 'New sign-in detected for your Microsoft account' (direct evidence of attention to sign-ins and account access).
Holistic values emphasize 'Security and personal data protection' and 'Account security & privacy' as primary themes.

supporting_evidence.pattern: Engages with established platform services (Microsoft ecosystem) for reliability and trust
examples: The single high-relevance email is from Microsoft, indicating active ties to major platform services.
Values list includes 'Reliability and trust in established platforms', suggesting platform-centered choices.

supporting_evidence.pattern: Leans toward efficiency, organization and automated control of digital life
examples: Interest areas include 'Use of productivity / email tooling' and 'Automation and control of digital life'.
Behavioral style emphasizes practical information preferences and automation-friendly values.

supporting_evidence.pattern: Decision style is cautious and habit-oriented with high choice autonomy
examples: Scoring shows high choice autonomy (0.90) and very high average ikigai score (0.95), indicating voluntary, self-directed attention to these themes.

framework_dimensions.external_connection: Connects to the world through major, trusted platforms (Microsoft) and through maintaining secure account relationships rather than broad social or community signaling.
framework_dimensions.active_engagement: Active monitoring and response-oriented — evidence is a reactive security alert and practical engagement with tooling; engagement is functional and intentional rather than exploratory.
framework_dimensions.emotional_meaning: Meaning appears tied to calm, confidence and reduced friction (knowing accounts are secure and systems are organized) rather than expressive or social reward.
framework_dimensions.voluntary_pursuit: Interests appear chosen and autonomy-driven (high choice autonomy), focused on pragmatic self-care of digital life rather than obligations.
framework_dimensions.everyday_joy: Small daily satisfactions likely come from tidy inboxes, predictable security routines (alerts, updates, automated protections), and smooth functioning of the Microsoft/productivity stack.
framework_dimensions.growth_orientation: Moderate — preference for practical learning and incremental improvement (automation, tools, habits) over radical reinvention; growth is pragmatic and skills-focused.

primary_themes: Automation and control of digital life

indicators: Receipt of a Microsoft 'new sign-in detected' security notification
Presence of account-review and security-update links indicates monitoring of account access
Products field lists 'Email Parser' alongside 'Microsoft account', implying use of tools to parse/organize email

interest_areas.area: Engagement with major platform services (Microsoft ecosystem)
indicators: Email originates from Microsoft account team, showing at least one active account with a major provider

value_indicators: Reliability and trust in established platforms
confidence_factors: Analysis based on a single email — limited signal for strong inferences
Some indicators (security notifications, listed products) suggest active choices, but defaults from large services could also explain them

top_themes: Engagement with major platform services (Microsoft ecosystem)
Automation and control of digital life

recommendations: Formalize simple, daily security rituals: a short weekly account-audit checklist (sign-in reviews, device list, app permissions) to convert reactive alerts into predictable routines.
Build a personal dashboard or single folder for security/productivity signals (security emails, shared docs, automation logs) so small wins are visible and repeated.

Invest time in one focused learning activity every quarter (e.g., Microsoft account advanced settings, password manager features, conditional access basics) to convert practical curiosity into durable expertise.
Automate low-effort protective actions (trusted device lists, multi-factor authentication apps, automated sign-in alerts) to align efficiency values with security outcomes.

Translate practical expertise into social value: document your routines (personal playbook) or mentor a peer on account hygiene — this reinforces meaning and turns private competence into contribution.

Explore integrated tooling that combines productivity and security (secure email add-ins, enterprise-grade password managers, Microsoft security features) to deepen engagement within trusted platforms.
Set measurable micro-goals (monthly reduction in unexpected alerts, time saved by automation) to maintain motivation through visible progress rather than abstract promises.

methodology_details.phase_1: Holistic overview analysis across all emails to extract themes and patterns
methodology_details.phase_2: Contextual per-email scoring using holistic insights
methodology_details.phase_3: Synthesis and validation for comprehensive ikigai profile
methodology_details.context_window_optimization: Adaptive batching based on model capabilities
methodology_details.inclusive_approach: Analyzes ALL email types including commercial for complete picture

top_themes: Engagement with major platform services (Microsoft ecosystem)
Automation and control of digital life
